column4: Do you still have the problem mounting your 4GB usb stick? I noticed that in two earlier posts, you specified "/dev/sdd" in your mount command; it should be "dev/sdd1".
Do you still have the problem mounting your 4GB usb stick? I noticed that in two earlier posts, you specified "/dev/sdd" in your mount command; it should be "dev/sdd1".
It is often a good idea to inspect your connected drives, via:   sfdisk -l   -OR-   df -h    -OR-   blkid
http://pastebin.com/SeebeCwv
Wait, i will look...
http://pastebin.com/9u5mSAvh
What is that from?
OK, the last pastebin was output of blkid command.  Show me sfdisk -l  with your 4GB usb stick plugged in.
OK, the last pastebin was output of blkid command.  Show me sfdisk -l  with your 4GB usb stick plugged in.
sudo sfdisk -l
Run the command: sudo sfdisk -l
See the /dev/sdd1 , that is what you should mount...
.. but tell me what you have installed on it ?
i believe what is a problem of kernel i compiled my kernel
Oh, yes I remember you discuss it with another person..
...but can you (or do you want to) try another  usb stick ?
Your last pastebin (581876), I saw already, but its too complicated for me.
Do you have Ubuntu installed on the 4 GB usb stick? (PS: Right now I am running Lubuntu 'Live-CD' on a 4GB usb stick.)
i need reboot i install kernel 2.6.35-27
OK. See you later.
kernel kernel 6.2.1935-27 work well the pendrive is very possible that I have compiled the kernel wrong
I see..
